tmt.visi package¶

Submodules¶

tmt.visi.api module¶

tmt.visi.stk module¶

class tmt.visi.stk.Stk(input_dir, wildcards, config)[source]¶

Bases: object

Class for a visi project.

A visi project corresponds to a folder holding .stk and .nd files.

create_joblist(batch_size, rename=True)[source]¶

Create list of jobs for parallel processing.

A joblist has the following structure (YAML format):

- job_id: int
  stk_files: List[str]
  nd_file:  str
  png_files: List[str]
  output_dir: str

- job_id: int
  stk_files: List[str]
  nd_file:  str
  png_files: List[str]
  output_dir: str

...
Parameters:
  • batch_size (int) – number of batches
  • rename (bool, optional) – whether files should be renamed according to configuration settings (defaults to True)
Returns:
Return type:

List[dict[str, list[str] or str]]
create_output_dirs(split_output)[source]¶

Create an output directory for each .nd file.

The elements may be the same or different depending on the value of split_output.

Parameters:split_output (bool) – Should output be split into separate folders for each .nd file?
Returns:
Return type:List[str]
files¶

Select files from input directory that match globbing pattern.

Returns:
Return type:List[str]
nd_files¶

Extract .nd files from the list of selected files.

Returns:
Return type:List[str]
read_joblist()[source]¶

Read joblist from YAML file.

Returns:
Return type:List[dict[str, list[str] or str]]
stk_files¶

Extract .stk files from the list of selected files, grouped by .nd file.

Returns:
Return type:List[list]
write_joblist()[source]¶

Write joblist to file as YAML.

tmt.visi.stk2png module¶

class tmt.visi.stk2png.Stk2png(input_files, nd_file, config)[source]¶

Bases: object

Class for unpacking .stk files outputted from Visitron microscopes and conversion to .png format (with optional file renaming).

calc_image_position()[source]¶

Calculate the y,x (row, column) position of images within the continuous acquisition grid, i.e. the well.

extract_info_from_filenames()[source]¶

Extract image information (such as channel, site, etc.) from filenames.

extract_info_from_nd_files()[source]¶

Extract meta information from .nd files, in particular information on the position within the well plate.

format_filenames(rename=True)[source]¶

If files should be renamed, first extract required information from metadata files (.nd) and filenames (.stk) and then format filenames according to nomenclature defined in configuration settings. Otherwise, simply replace ”.stk” suffix with ”.png”.

Parameters:rename (bool, optional) – whether files should be renamed according to configuration settings (defaults to True)
unpack_images(output_dir, output_files=None, keep_z=False)[source]¶

Read and upstack stk files and write images (z-stacks or MIPs) to disk as .png files.

Parameters:
  • output_dir (str) – directory where images should be saved
  • output_files (List[str], optional) – list of output filenames
  • keep_z (bool, optional) – keep individual z stacks (True) or perform maximum intensity projection (False - default)
tmt.visi.stk2png.determine_image_snake(stitch_dims, zig_zag)[source]¶

The image snake defines the position of each image in the stitched image.

Parameters:
  • stitch_dims (Tuple[int]) – y,x dimensions (height, width) of the stitched image
  • zig_zag (bool) – were images acquired in “ZigZag” mode?
Returns:

  • Dict[str, List[int]]
  • one-based “row” and “column” position of each image in the stitched image
tmt.visi.stk2png.format_nd(nd)[source]¶

Format .nd file content, i.e. translate it into python syntax.

Important keys:
  • DoStage
  • DoTimelapse
  • DoWave
  • DoZSeries
Parameters:nd (Dict[str, str or List[str]]) –
Returns:
Return type:Dict[str, str or List[str]]
tmt.visi.stk2png.guess_stitch_dims(max_position, layout)[source]¶

Simple algorithm to guess correct dimensions of a stitched image.

Parameters:
  • max_position (int) – maximum position in the stitched image
  • layout (str) – either “columns<rows” (more rows than columns) or “columns>rows” (vice versa)
Returns:

  • Tuple[int]
  • y, x dimensions (height, width) of the stitched image
tmt.visi.stk2png.read_nd(nd_filename)[source]¶

Read the content of the .nd file and do some pre-formatting.

Parameters:nd_filename (str) –
Returns:
Return type:Dict[str, str or List[str]]

Read stk file from disk and unpack individual stacks.

Parameters:stk_filename (str) –
Returns:
